ax.ha.it.smsalarm

Class KitKatHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ax.ha.it.smsalarm.KitKatHandler

  • public class KitKatHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for any special handling that needs to be done according to KitKat's (and higher) retarded behavior when receiving an sms.
    LogHandler is a singleton.

    Note!
    This class and it's functionality is still in BETA state.

    Since:
    2.2.1
    Version:
    2.2.1
    Author:
    Robert Nyholm

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static KitKatHandler getInstance()
        Method to get the singleton instance of this class.
        Returns:
        Singleton instance of LogHandler

      • handleKitKat

        public void handleKitKat(Context context)
        To handle the retarded sms behavior of Android API lvl's KitKat and higher. What happens is that the device is put to AudioManager.RINGER_MODE_SILENT for a certain amount of time. This is to make it look like only SmsAlarm received the sms.
        The notifications bar is expanded and after a certain amount of time collapsed, this is to pop away the default sms applications LED notification from the queue so out LED notification goes through.
        Parameters:
        context - Context from which to get system services.
        See Also:
        setSilent(), expandCollapseNotificationsBarWithDelay(), LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • expandNotificationsBar

        private void expandNotificationsBar()
        To expand the notifications bar.
        See Also:
        handleNotificationsBar(NotificationsBarActions), LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • collapseNotificationsBar

        private void collapseNotificationsBar()
        To collapse the notifications bar.
        See Also:
        handleNotificationsBar(NotificationsBarActions), LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • handleNotificationsBar

        private void handleNotificationsBar(KitKatHandler.NotificationsBarActions notificationsBarAction)
        To handle the notifications bar according to given NotificationsBarActions. Following actions are supported:
        • NotificationsBarActions.EXPAND
        • NotificationsBarActions.COLLAPSE
        Parameters:
        notificationsBarAction -
        See Also:
        isInitialized(), LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String), LogHandler.logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • expandCollapseNotificationsBarWithDelay

        private void expandCollapseNotificationsBarWithDelay()
        To expand the notifications bar for a certain amount of time. After elapsed time the notifications bar is collapsed.
        See Also:
        expandNotificationsBar(), collapseNotificationsBar(), LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • setSilentModeWithDelay

        private void setSilentModeWithDelay()
        To change device's RINGER_MODE to AudioManager.RINGER_MODE_SILENT for a certain amount of time, after elapsed time the ringer mode is restored.
        See Also:
        setSilent(), restoreRingerMode(), LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • setSilent

        private boolean setSilent()
        To set devices ringer mode into AudioManager.RINGER_MODE_SILENT.
        Returns:
        true if ringer mode change was successful else false.
        See Also:
        isInitialized(), LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String), LogHandler.logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • getRingerModeDelay

        public int getRingerModeDelay()
        To get this objects ringer mode delay in ms.
        Returns:
        This objects RINGER_MODE_DELAY.

      • restoreRingerMode

        private void restoreRingerMode()
        To restore the devices ringer as it was before the device was set to AudioManager.RINGER_MODE_SILENT. Of course this is only done if it's needed.
        See Also:
        isInitialized(), isValidRingerMode(), LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • isIdle

        public boolean isIdle()
        To figure out if this object is idle or not. By not being idle means that a ringer mode switch is in progress.
        Returns:
        true if object is idle else false.

      • isInitialized

        private boolean isInitialized()
        Helper method to figure out if this object has been correctly initialized. This object is seen as initialized if it's Context and AudioManager isn't null.
        Returns:
        true if correctly initialized else false.
        See Also:
        LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String), LogHandler.logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String)

      • isValidRingerMode

        private boolean isValidRingerMode()
        Helper method to figure out if this objects RINGER_MODE is valid. In other words some of following:

        • AudioManager.RINGER_MODE_SILENT
        • AudioManager.RINGER_MODE_VIBRATE
        • AudioManager.RINGER_MODE_NORMAL
        Returns:
        true if this object holds a valid ringer mode else false.
        See Also:
        LogHandler.logCat(LogPriorities, String, String), LogHandler.logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String)
